stories.headline: Disaster on Deadline
stories.summary: Newsday's newsroom mobilized quickly to cover the TWA Flight 800 crash. Reporters used computer-assisted reporting (CAR) to gather data from aviation databases, which helped give a fuller understanding of the plane's safety record. The coverage won a Pulitzer Prize for its depth and immediacy.

stories.headline: Probing HUD Woes
stories.summary: The Seattle Times investigation into HUD's Indian housing program uncovered corruption and mismanagement, showing that funds for low-income housing were being misused. The series prompted reforms and won a Pulitzer Prize for Investigative Reporting.

stories.headline: Hook, line & Pulitzer
stories.summary: An investigation into the global status of fisheries by The Times-Picayune exposed alarming trends and the effects of market pressures on fish populations. This led to the Pulitzer Prize for Public Service.

stories.headline: Fear of Flying
stories.summary: Reporter Byron Acohido investigates recurring rudder-control problems on Boeing 737s after a series of crashes. His two-year reporting project resulted in safety improvements mandated by the FAA and earned a Pulitzer Prize.
